notesStmt.note: Generated using Cheryl J. Plumb's "Original Version and Related Drafts" of the novel.

app.rdg: “Kneeling in a dark corner, bending my head over and down,

because it was his turn; I had tried everything else. There was nothing for it this time but to make him face the mystery so it could see him clear as it saw me. So then I whispered, ‘What is this thing, Lord?’ And I began to cry…I was crying and striking my left hand against the
and all the while Tiny O’Toole was lying in swoon. ..’I’m not able to stay permanent unless you help me, O Book of Concealment!
C’est le plaisir qui me boulverse!
The roaring lion goes forth, seeking his own fury! So tell me, what is permanent of me, me or him?
